meanings.definition: Gauched (verb): past tense of gauch, meaning to behave in a socially awkward or clumsy manner.
meanings.sent1: She gauched her way through the party, knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent2: He always gauched around his crush, tripping over his own feet.
meanings.sent3: The penguin gauched on the ice, slipping and sliding comically.
meanings.sent4: Her words gauched out of her mouth, causing an awkward silence.
meanings.sent5: The new student gauched into the classroom, bumping into desks and chairs.

meanings.definition: Gauched (adjective): awkward or clumsy in manner or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The gauched waiter spilled drinks on the customers.
meanings.sent2: She felt gauched as she tripped over the welcome mat.
meanings.sent3: His gauched dance moves made everyone giggle at the party.
meanings.sent4: The gauched painting hung crookedly on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The gauched puppy stumbled over its own paws, trying to play.
